page.title: 18Norham-Country sounds
page.content: From my window I hear cows mooing in the fields, horses trotting past on the road and dogs barking. I try to separate the sounds of the birds - pigeons, wood pigeons, starlings, sparrows, blackbirds, hens, bantams, swallows, thrushes, robins, geese, swans whooping overhead, seagulls, oyster catchers, blue tits, chaffinches, ducks, crows, wrens and owls. Jets fly overhead, and sometimes helicopters and small air craft. The intermittent sounds of cars, tractors, combine harvesters, motor bikes, lorries and buses hurry past the drive. The excited cries of a football game float over the hedge. At night I hear the bird scarer, the river bubbling, the church clock chime, granny singing, footsteps, gun shots and the wind rustling leaves.
